history.content:
You are allowed to take classes in any order as long as you have the appropriate prereqs

Edit: I'm specifically talking about L&S, EECS may be different

---

As far as I know the above student answer is incorrect; you have to take two (2) classes which progress you towards your degree requirements every semester. Both of my roommates ran into this problem (trying to stall on taking a required breadth) and were told they'd have their enrollment blocked for the following semester until they fulfilled the prereqs. This is for EECS specifically.

You are allowed to take classes in any order as long as you have the appropriate prereqs

You are allowed to take classes in any order

Hi, I was wondering if there is a requirement to make progress towards your major every semester. So for example, if I've fulfilled all my major requirements except 1 breadth before my Fall Senior semester, can I wait until Spring Senior semester to take the breadth?

Thanks!
history.subject: Requirements
